definition: to rush/to charge/to dash/to break through/to temper oneself (through battling hardships)

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
to run a red light/failing to stop at a red traffic light/(slang) to have sex with a girl while she is menstruating
to leave home to make one's way in the world/to leave the life one knows to seek success
to cause an accident/to make trouble/to get into trouble
Chuangwang or Roaming King, adopted name of late Ming peasant rebel leader Li Zicheng 李自成 (1605-1645)
person who crashes through a barrier/gate-crasher
to make a name for oneself

mausoleum to late Ming peasant rebel leader Li Zicheng 李自成 (who styled himself Chuang Wang): one in Jiugongshan 九宫山 nature reserve, Tongshan county, Xianning prefecture, Hubei, and another in Shimen 石门, Changde 常德, Hunan, built starting in 1980
to break into a house when nobody is home

sentences.english: It is always good for young people to be put upon exerting themselves.
sentences.chinese: 让青年人自己去闯闯总是有好处的。

sentences.english: It is always good for young people to be put upon exerting themselves.
sentences.chinese: 让青年人自己去闯闯总是有好处的。

sentences.english: Behind the development of the region's biggest re GREt is not dare to break through.
sentences.chinese: 发展滞后地区的最大遗憾是不敢闯。

sentences.english: They must have thought they were going to get in trouble.
sentences.chinese: 她们立马四散而逃，她们肯定以为自己闯了什么大祸。

sentences.english: I am tempted to discover another world and to see what footballing life is like outside England.
sentences.chinese: 我希望出去闯一闯，看看国外的足球世界是怎么样的。

sentences.english: Small radioactive source results in big accident" have occurred repeatedly in China and worldwide alike."
sentences.chinese: “小源闯大祸”已经在国内外发生多次。

sentences.english: And I need to take a risk.
And I need to take a risk.
The door opened and in came a group of soldiers.
sentences.chinese: 门一开，一群士兵闯了进来。

sentences.english: Liu Chuang and Liang Wenbo are making their debut in Sheffield this year, in fact.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，今年是刘闯和梁文博在谢菲尔德的首次登场。

sentences.english: The door burst open and the children rushed in.
sentences.chinese: 门突然撞开了，孩子们闯了进来。

sentences.english: They come to a red light. The driver runs the red light.
sentences.chinese: 当他们遇到红灯时，司机竟闯了过去。

sentences.english: I got a traffic ticket because I ran the red light.
sentences.chinese: 我收到了一张交通罚款单，因为我闯了红灯。

sentences.english: The robber break open his house.
sentences.chinese: 强盗们砸开了他家的大门闯了进去。

sentences.english: The police burst in and told everyone to stand still.
sentences.chinese: 警察闯了进来，叫大家站着不动。

sentences.english: You're heading for an accident if you drive after drinking.
sentences.chinese: 如果你酒后开车，会闯出车祸。

definition: lit. bashing sideways and colliding straight on (idiom); to push through shoving and bumping/to barge/to charge around violently
to knock against/to bump into/to run into/to meet by accident
to act arbitrarily regardless of the rules/to mess with sth/to make a hash of things/to cause trouble
lit. single spear and horse (idiom); fig. single-handed/unaccompanied
nine deaths and still alive (idiom); a narrow escape/new lease of life
